If I select several links to open in tabs, all the links being from the same Web page, they should open left-to-right, not right-to-left.  

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Do a Bugzilla search, obtaining a list of bug reports sorted by increasing bug numbers.  

2.  Working down the list, select several reports to open in tabs.  

Actual Results:  
The tab closest to the list of bug reports is the last report selected.  

Expected Results:  
The tab closest to the list of bug reports is the first report selected so that, by selecting tabs in sequence, the reports can be viewed in the order they were selected.

Here is a revised "Steps to Reproduce".  

1.  Do a Bugzilla search, obtaining a list of at least five bug reports sorted by increasing bug numbers.  

2.  Working down the list (in numerical order), select two reports to open in tabs.  

3.  Select the tab for one of those two reports.  

4.  Return to the tab for the list of reports.  

5.  Select another report from the list, a report further down the list than the two that were already selected.  

Actual Results:  
The tab for the report selected in step #5 is immediately adjacent to the tab for the list of reports.  

Expected Results:  
The tab for the report selected in step #5 should be beyond the tabs for the reports selected in step #2.  This is because all tabs (other than the list of reports) resulted from selecting links on the first tab; thus, they should be in the same order as the links were selected.

comments.text:
Re comment #4:  

I would not change how the present design behaves in those examples.  That is because the user has actually done something within the new tabs (tab A3 in the example).  

When the user merely looks at a tab and possibly closes it, however, I would change the behavior:
Open three tabs from A: A A1 A2 A3
View tab A2.
Return to tab A.
Open another tab A4:  A A1 A2 A3 A4

I sometimes open several tabs in quick succession.  This is true when checking bug reports from a query list.  It is also true when viewing news sites and opening tabs for specific news articles.  In this case, I sometimes check a tab before opening all "interesting" tabs to make sure it was something I really want to view.  I don't really read the entire content of that tab until all the tabs are open.  With the current behavior, I quickly lose track of which tabs are which.
